questions.question: What is the error code for Die Shù Chà (Falling Front Split)?
What are the two main deduction points for Die Shù Chà?
questions.answer: Deductions are applied when: 1) The sole of the front foot turns inward and touches the ground, and 2) Front and rear legs do not form two parallel straight lines.

questions.question: What is the correct foot position for the front foot in Die Shù Chà?
questions.answer: The sole of the front foot should not turn inward or touch the ground.

questions.question: How should the legs be aligned in a correct Die Shù Chà technique?
questions.answer: The front and rear legs should form two parallel straight lines.
